thread.title: New Year's Rockin' Eve viewers awestruck by Diana Ross' 'ageless' appearance - NewsBreak
thread.title_full: New Year's Rockin' Eve viewers awestruck by Diana Ross' 'ageless' appearance - NewsBreak

author: Hannah Furnell
title: New Year's Rockin' Eve viewers awestruck by Diana Ross' 'ageless' appearance - NewsBreak
text:
By Hannah Furnell ,
3 hours ago
Viewers of Dick Clark's New Year's Rockin' Eve with Ryan Seacrest were stunned when music icon Diana Ross took the stage minutes before Times Square's ball dropped.
The 81-year-old donned a ruby red gown and matching robe as she performed a medley of her biggest hits about 10 minutes before midnight in New York City .
Online, her fans gushed about her "ageless" appearance during the New Year's Eve special, while one person criticized the special's showrunners for making her perform out in the cold instead of inside for a pre-taped set.
On X, formerly Twitter, one person praised the singer, "Diana Ross looks & sounds AMAZING," as another gushed, "Diana Ross looks incredible!!"
A third commented, "Diana ross you are everything and more," as a fourth said, "Diana Ross still look good." A fifth questioned, "Does Diana Ross age?"
Diana Ross sang a medley of her hits during her performance on New Year's Rockin' Eve Get all the latest news, entertainment, sport and lifestyle updates from our dedicated American team.
Sign up for our newsletters HERE .
Yet another praised the singer with, "Yes.. The Queen has arrived! Ms Diana Ross!" as someone else chimed in, "The LEGEND. Diana Ross."
However, one fan pointed out, "We really got Ms Diana Ross in cold a-- Time Square when everybody else got pre-taped performances."
Out of all of the positive comments aimed at Ross, there was one negative one that read, "I can assure you @ABC7, I was never waiting for Diana Ross to ring in 2026 Lame."
Earlier during Dick Clark's New Year's Rockin' Eve with Ryan Seacrest, viewers were divided over the show's name.
TV legend Dick Clark created New Year's Rockin' Eve in 1971 and went on to host the show until 2004. He went on to co-host following his stroke that year until his death in 2012.

Wheel of Fortune host Ryan Seacrest forced to steal watch back from the contestant [INSIGHT]
Ryan Seacrest 'seems exhausted all the time' after recent weight loss [UPDATE]
One Diana Ross fan questioned why Rockin' Eve showrunners made her perform outside The 51-year-old American Idol host took over as co-host in 2005. He's been hosting solo since the 2012-13 installment, but has been accompanied by various guest correspondents, including Rita Ora, who has been with him since the 2023-24 edition.
Dick Clark's New Year's Rockin' Eve was renamed Dick Clark's New Year's Rockin' Eve with Ryan Seacrest in 2008, but fans are still not happy.
On X, formerly Twitter, one person wrote, "Isn't there a statue of limitations on how many years they can still call it 'Dick Clark's Rockin New Year's Eve'? I mean, WHEN DOES RYAN SEACREST GET HIS SHINE??"
Another person countered, "New Year's Eve is not the same without Dick Clark. Dick Clark's New Year's Rockin' Eve with Ryan Seacrest is not the same, but at least they kept Dick Clark's name in it, and I respect that. When I don't respect and don't understand is why it never rocks anymore."
Diana Ross fans loved her performance Clark died of a "massive heart attack" at a Los Angeles hospital in 2012. He was 82.
Following the TV icon's death, Seacrest wrote on his website , "I am deeply saddened by the loss of my dear friend Dick Clark. He has truly been one of the greatest influences in my life."
He added, "I idolized him from the start, and I was graced early on in my career with his generous advice and counsel. When I joined his show in 2006, it was a dream come true to work with him every New Year's Eve for the last 6 years.
"He was smart, charming, funny and always a true gentleman. I learned a great deal from him, and I'll always be indebted to him for his faith and support of me."
20
